Agency: Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement
Bureau of Safety and Environmental Enforcement

Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced that Newfield Production Company (Newfield) has settled violations of the Safe Drinking Water Act in the Monument Butte Well Field in Duchesne County, Utah on the Uintah and Ouray Reservation. Under the terms of a consent decree lodged with the United States District Court on October 23, Newfield has agreed to pay $600,000 for failing to demonstrate financial responsibility associated with the safe operation of 442 injection wells on the Reservation from March 2009 through September 2010.

The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced that Denver, Colorado-based Newfield Production Company (Newfield) has agreed to resolve alleged Clean Water Act violations and complete wetlands restoration and creation projects at production sites in Uintah and Duchesne counties in Utah's Uinta Basin. The company will also pay a penalty of $175,000.

Description: Encana Oil & Gas agreed to pay $5 million in a civil settlement, and pleaded guilty to one count of criminal attempted antitrust violations,  as part of resolution of allegations it conspired with Chesapeake Energy Corp. to avoid bidding wars for oil and gas leases.

Company: Encana Oil and Gas USA Inc.

Description: Encana agreed to pay $49,000 civil penalties and fund a supplementary environmental project at a cost of at least $231,000 in settlement of numerous alleged violations of Air Quality and Environmental regulations at facilities in the state.
